alert.note: Alert for Mesa (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued April 13 at 3:43PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...Increased Flows on the San Miguel and Dolores River Due to Snowmelt... Snowmelt from above normal/record seasonal snowpack has increased the flow well above normal for this time of year along the San Miguel and Dolores Rivers. In addition, rain or mix of rain and snow expected this evening may locally accelerate snowmelt within these river basins. Colder temperatures arriving in the wake of this system will decrease the rate of snowmelt this weekend, providing some relief to increased flow rates. Until then, county roadways and low lying areas along the San Miguel and Dolores River within the counties of Mesa and Montrose, may be inundated with water and may not be passable. Please heed all road closures and find an alternate route.
